subject: Design
title: The AED: Designing for Panic
description: A fast breakdown of The AED: Designing for Panic for builders.

hook.text: A defibrillator must be usable by a panicking bystander who's never seen one. That's the hardest design brief ever.

buildup.text: AED designers must assume the user is terrified, has zero training, and is watching someone die.

discovery.text: Modern AEDs use voice prompts, pictogram-only instructions, and two buttons. Open, stick, press.

twist.text: The device analyzes heart rhythm and won't shock unless needed. It's designed to be smarter than the user.

climax.text: AED design proves that life-saving products must design for the worst-case user, not the ideal one.

punchline.text: The best-designed medical device talks you through saving a life.

quiz.question: What design principle guides AED development?
